Wechsler adult intelligence scale-revise.Definition: a general test of intelligence, which Wechsler defined as, and#34;... the global capacity of the individual to act purposefully, to think rationally, and to deal effectively with his environment.and#34; In keeping with this definition of intelligence as an aggregate of mental aptitudes or abilities, the WAIS-R consists of 11 subtests divided into two parts, verbal and performance.
